net.hypixel.skyblock.util

Class TimeConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hypixel.skyblock.util.TimeConverter

  • public class TimeConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    A conversion between hours and in-game ticks.
    Since:
    09 June 2019
    Version:
    07 October 2020
    Author:
    MrPineapple070

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<java.lang.Long> hours
      An ImmutableList that converts hours to Minecraft Ticks.
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> nameToTicks
      A Map from String to Long.
      Useful for getting time using common names.
      Example: the Map.get(Object) with "sunrise" as input will return 23000l
      private static java.text.SimpleDateFormat SDFTwelve
      A SimpleDateFormat used to format time to 12-hour format.
      private static java.text.SimpleDateFormat SDFTwentyFour
      A SimpleDateFormat used to format time to 24-hour format.
      static int ticksPerDay
      The number of ticks in a day
      static int ticksPerHour
      The number of ticks in an hour.
      static double ticksPerMinute
      The number of ticks in a minute.
      static double ticksPerSecond
      The number of ticks in a second.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String format12(long ticks)
      Formats the number of ticks in a 12-hour format.
      static java.lang.String format24(long ticks)
      Formats the number of ticks in a 24-hour format.
      static java.lang.String formatDateFormat(long ticks, java.text.SimpleDateFormat format)
      Formats the number of ticks using format.
      static java.lang.String formatTicks(long ticks)
      Formats the number of ticks to be readable.
      static long hoursMinutesToTicks(int hours, int minutes)
      Converts hours and minutes into in-game time.
      This method does not ensure that minutes < 60 or minutes and hours > 0.
      static long parse(java.lang.String desc)
      Master Converter.
      Converts a description of the ticks into the number of ticks.
      static long parse12(java.lang.String desc)
      Converts a 12-hour description to the number of ticks.
      The description is expected to String.matches(String) with "^[0-9]{1,2}([^0-9]?[0-9]{2})?(pm|am)$"
      Uses hoursMinutesToTicks(int, int) to convert.
      static long parse24(java.lang.String desc)
      Converts a description of the ticks into the number of ticks.
      The description is expected to String.matches(String) with "^[0-9]{2}[^0-9]?[0-9]{2}$".
      Uses hoursMinutesToTicks(int, int)
      static long parseAlias(java.lang.String desc)
      Converts a description into in-game time.
      Uses nameToTicks.
      static long parseTicks(java.lang.String desc)
      Converts a description of the ticks into the number of ticks.
      The description is expected to String.matches(String) with "^[0-9]+ti?c?k?s?$"
      Examples: 0t, 0ticks
      static java.util.Date ticksToDate(long ticks)
      Converts a number of ticks to a Date.

        Example: the Map.get(Object) with "sunrise" as input will return 23000l

      • hoursMinutesToTicks

        public static long hoursMinutesToTicks(int hours,
                                       int minutes)
        Converts hours and minutes into in-game time.
        This method does not ensure that minutes < 60 or minutes and hours > 0.
        Parameters:
        hours - the number of hours
        minutes - the number of minutes.
        Returns:
        converted time.

      • parse

        public static long parse(java.lang.String desc)
                  throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Master Converter.
        Converts a description of the ticks into the number of ticks. Attepts to convert in this order.
        1. parseTicks(String)
        2. parse24(String)
        3. parse12(String)
        4. parseAlias(String)
        Parameters:
        desc - the description of the ticks.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks described
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if desc is not valid.

      • parse12

        public static long parse12(java.lang.String desc)
                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a 12-hour description to the number of ticks.
        The description is expected to String.matches(String) with "^[0-9]{1,2}([^0-9]?[0-9]{2})?(pm|am)$"
        Uses hoursMinutesToTicks(int, int) to convert.
        Parameters:
        desc - the description of the time.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks described.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if desc is not valid.

      • parse24

        public static long parse24(java.lang.String desc)
                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a description of the ticks into the number of ticks.
        The description is expected to String.matches(String) with "^[0-9]{2}[^0-9]?[0-9]{2}$".
        Uses hoursMinutesToTicks(int, int)
        Parameters:
        desc - the description of the ticks.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks described
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if desc is not valid.

      • parseAlias

        public static long parseAlias(java.lang.String desc)
                       throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a description into in-game time.
        Uses nameToTicks.
        Parameters:
        desc - the description of the time.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if desc

      • parseTicks

        public static long parseTicks(java.lang.String desc)
                       throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a description of the ticks into the number of ticks.
        The description is expected to String.matches(String) with "^[0-9]+ti?c?k?s?$"
        Examples: 0t, 0ticks
        Parameters:
        desc - the description of the ticks.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks described
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if desc is not valid.

      • ticksToDate

        public static java.util.Date ticksToDate(long ticks)
        Converts a number of ticks to a Date.
        Parameters:
        ticks - the current in-game time.
        Returns:
        converted ticks.
